comments.body:
Do you have a little doc that explain how to install the lib? I've just downloaded `vsan-sdk-python.zip` from VMware website, but I don't see any installation procedure.

This dependency sounds rather problematic to me because it's not part of the existing requirements of the other VMware modules, in addition, it's not a freeesoftware. Do you know any alternative?

You will find documentation in the README file (at the root of the zip file) and also in this blog post - https://www.virtuallyghetto.com/2016/03/getting-started-with-the-new-vsan-6-2-management-api.html

As far as I know, this SDK is the only available and also the only supported by VMware. I asked some guys at VMware if it will be open sourced one day but I didn't get any answers...

Is it really an issue as far as this requirement is stated in the documentation and checks are made in the code ?

You should mention the extra dependency in the `requirements` section:

https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/dev_guide/developing_modules_documenting.html#documentation-block

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +23,27 @@description:
    - "Gather information about a VMware vSAN cluster's health"

options:
    cluster_name:
